articles.author: Alan Selby
articles.title: SAS goes vegan as third of new recruits ditch meat to avoid food poisoning - Mirror Online
articles.description: EXCLUSIVE Members of the crack unit are also turning vegetarian, including Ant Middleton host of Channel 4’s SAS Who Dares Wins
articles.content:
Raw recruits to the elite SAS are shunning meat in their diets.
Three in 10 of those taken on by the crack unit told bosses they are vegetarian or vegan.
Soldiers burn up to 3,500 calories a day tr… [+1142 chars]

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Archaeology news: Catastrophic 54ft mega tsunami struck Stone Age Israel, study finds - Daily Express
articles.description: ARCHAEOLOGISTS have found evidence of a 54ft-tall mega tsunami crashing into Israel's Carmel coast more than 9,000 years ago.

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Yellowstone volcano: Drilling experiment triggered a 'violent eruption' of scorching steam - Daily Express
articles.description: YELLOWSTONE scientists drilling into the volatile supervolcano in the 1960s triggered an unexpected 'violent eruption' caused by scorching water mixing with steam underground.

articles.author: Dan Avery
articles.title: ISS astronauts celebrate Christmas with decorating contest, canned mackerel and 'visit' from Santa - Daily Mail
articles.description: The Expedition 64 crew sent season's greetings in videos beamed from the ISS. The team also challenged NASA flight director Zebulon Scoville to a Christmas decorating contest.
articles.content:
Christmas isn't just an earthbound holiday: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station beamed special holiday greetings this week from 254 miles above the planet.
